title: COAST ORB / feldwindows
description: A conversation with SF about the inside of the building and hiding.

dialogueTree.title: Perception (Hearing): "The remaining windows rattle from a..."
dialogueTree.english: The remaining windows rattle from a strong gust of wind. They're covered in a thick layer of grime. They must have been like this for forty years.
dialogueTree.polish: Pozostałe jeszcze okna stukają, poruszone silnym powiewem wiatru. Pokryte są grubą warstwą brudu. Nikt ich musiał nie czyścić od czterdziestu lat.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Астатнія акны стукаюць, узрушаны моцным парывам ветру. Яны пакрытыя тоўстым пластом бруду. Ніхто, мусіць, не чысціў іх сорак гадоў.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Dripping water falls from a high pl..."
links.english: Dripping water falls from a high place. All you can see is the shadow of a collapsing staircase.
links.polish: Woda skapuje gdzieś z wysoka. Widzisz tylko cień chylących się ku upadkowi schodów.
links.belarusian: Вада капае дзесьці з вышыні. Ты бачыш толькі цень, які нахіляецца да падзення лесвіцы.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There's rust and corrosion on the b..."
links.english: There's rust and corrosion on the bars, they're foaming with it. And a small layer of white salt from the sea.
links.polish: Na wspornikach widać rdzę, korozję. Nieomal się od niej pienią. Widzisz też cienką warstwę morskiej soli.
links.belarusian: На апорах відаць іржу, карозію. Яны амаль пеняцца ад яе. Ты таксама бачыш тонкі пласт марской солі.

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, can you make out what'..."
links.english: "Lieutenant, can you make out what's inside?" (Point at the windows.)
links.polish: „Poruczniku, widzisz może, co jest w środku?” (Wskaż okna).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No." He shakes his head. The windo..."
links.english: "No." He shakes his head. The windows rattle in their frames. "I won't even try. You know..." He takes his glasses off.
links.polish: „Nie” – porucznik kręci głową. Szyby drżą w swoich ramach. „Nie będę nawet próbował. No wiesz...” – stwierdza, zdejmując swoje okulary.
links.belarusian: «Не», — лейтэнант трасе галавой. Шкло дрыжыць у рамах. «Я нават не буду спрабаваць. Ну, ведаеш...» — зазначае, здымаючы свае акуляры.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I had a partner once. They called..."
links.english: "I had a partner once. They called him Eyes, because he had to show me things. It's that bad."
links.polish: „Miałem kiedyś partnera. Nazywali go Oczy, bo musiał pokazywać mi różne rzeczy. Aż tak kiepski jest mój wzrok”.
links.belarusian: «У мяне калісьці быў партнёр. Яго называлі Вочы, бо ён мусіў паказваць мне розныя рэчы. Мой зрок такі кепскі».

links.title: Empathy: "This partner of his, Eyes -- things..."
links.english: This partner of his, Eyes -- things didn't end well. It saddens him to say his name. Don't even ask. He wouldn't answer. Maybe some other small talk?
links.polish: Ten jego partner, Oczy... Nie skończyło się to dobrze. Wspominanie jego imienia napełnia go smutkiem. Nie pytaj. Nie odpowie ci. Może lepiej zagaić o czym innym?
links.belarusian: Его партнёр, Вочы... Гэта не скончылася добра. Успамінанне яго імя напаўняе яго смуткам. Не пытай. Ён не адкажа табе. Можа, лепш пачаць размову пра нешта іншае?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well enough, actually. It's odd ho..."
links.english: "Well enough, actually. It's odd how that works. I'm no sharpshooter, but I pass my shooting courses 7 out of 10."
links.polish: „Wystarczająco dobrze. Trochę to dziwne. Nie jestem strzelcem wyborowym, ale zaliczam egzaminy na strzelnicy z wynikiem 7 na 10”.
links.belarusian: «Даволі добра. Гэта крыху дзіўна. Я не снайпер, але здаю экзамены ў цір з вынікам 7 з 10».

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "His hands lead the way when it come..."
links.english: His hands lead the way when it comes to that. And his shoulders. It's reflex.
links.polish: Wtedy kontrolę przejmują jego ręce. I ramiona. To odruch.
links.belarusian: Тады кантроль пераймаюць яго рукі. І плечы. Гэта рэфлекс.
